title: Test pre-commit setup with all languages
description:
## Problem Statement
Need to verify pre-commit works correctly for all configured languages and auto-fix functions properly.

## Solution Approach
Test each language hook individually, test manual runs, test git hook integration, verify auto-fix.

## Files to Change
None - testing existing setup

## Requirements (from specs/lint-automation/spec.md)
- Markdown files: markdownlint-cli2 checks and auto-fixes
- Shell scripts: shellcheck performs static analysis
- Lua files: stylua auto-formats
- Python files: ruff checks and auto-fixes
- JavaScript files: eslint checks and auto-fixes
- TypeScript files: eslint + @typescript-eslint checks and auto-fixes
- Go files: golangci-lint checks
- Git-aware: only changed files are checked

## Dependencies
⚠️ This task requires:
- Task df-ja0.2: Tools installed
- Task df-ja0.3: Config file created
- Task df-ja0.4: Git hooks installed

## Expected Outcome
- All language hooks execute successfully
- Auto-fix works for supported languages
- Git hook triggers on commit
- Only staged files are linted

## Verification Steps
- [ ] Test manual run: `pre-commit run --all-files` - executes successfully
- [ ] Test per-language: Create sample files (.md, .sh, .lua, .py, .js, .ts, .go) with intentional issues
- [ ] Verify auto-fix: Check if trailing whitespace, formatting issues are fixed automatically
- [ ] Test git hook: Stage file, run git commit, verify linters run before commit
- [ ] Test selective run: `pre-commit run --files file.py` - only checks that file
- [ ] Claude invocation: Ask Claude to run pre-commit - no permission prompt

## Context
This validates the entire setup. Test files can be temporary and deleted after verification. Some hooks may skip if no files of that type exist.
